Align stdeb dependencies with setup.py (#101)

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Add '+upstream' suffix to published deb version (#102)

Using a debian version suffix which falls late alphabetically appears to
give our packages preference by apt. If a user enables a repository
which distributes packages created by OSRF or ROS, it is likely that
they wish to use these packages instead of the ones packaged by their
platform.

Update deb platforms for release (#95)

Dropped:

Retained:

* Ubuntu Focal (20.04 LTS)
* Ubuntu Jammy (22.04 LTS)

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Catch all of the spurious warnings from get_event_loop. (#94)

The previous patch that did this only did it for one of
the cases, but we actually need to catch this warning for
all cases of get_event_loop().  Do that here by wrapping
the entire block in catch_warnings().  With this in
place, other spurious warnings from downstream packages
(like launch) are also quieted.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Declare test dependencies in [test] extra (#86)

Adding a test dependency on 'pytest' will cause colcon to use pytest
when running the package's tests, which yields a better experience than
the existing fallback to unittest.

Don't release 2.x / master on Debian Buster. (#83)

Debian Buster is on Python 3.7: https://packages.debian.org/buster/python3

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Stop using mock in favor of unittest.mock. (#74)

Mock has been deprecated since Python 3.3; see
https://pypi.org/project/mock/ .  The recommended replacement
is unittest.mock, which seems to be a drop-in replacement.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Michał Górny
data.message:
Fix dependencies (#81)

* Remove obsolete setuptools from install_requires

Now that pkg_resources are no longer used, there is no need to depend
on setuptools at runtime.

* Fix version-conditional dependency on importlib-metadata

Use version markers to depend on importlib-metadata correctly.  Explicit
conditions mean that wheels built with setup.py will either have the dep
or not depending on what Python version they're built with, rather than
what version they're installed on.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove use of pkg_resources from osrf_pycommon. (#66)

* Remove use of pkg_resources from osrf_pycommon.

Replace it with the use of the more modern importlib*
libraries.  There are a couple of reasons to do this:

1.  pkg_resources is quite slow to import; on my machine,
just firing up the python interpreter takes ~35ms, while
firing up the python interpreter and importing pkg_resources
takes ~175ms.  Firing up the python interpreter and importing
importlib_metadata takes ~70ms.  Removing 100ms per invocation
of the command-line both makes it speedier for users, and
will speed up our tests (which call out to the command-line
quite a lot).

2.  pkg_resources is somewhat deprecated and being replaced
by importlib.  https://importlib-metadata.readthedocs.io/en/latest/using.html
describes some of it

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* depend on importlib-metadata everywhere

Signed-off-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

* Fixes from review.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* restrict suites to only include ones that have python3-importlib-metadata

Signed-off-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

* add note to README about release changes

Signed-off-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

Co-authored-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove deprecated use of asyncio.coroutine decorator. (#64)

In later versions of Python, @asyncio.coroutine is deprecated
in favor of "async def".  However, in order to support python
back to 3.6, we also have to switch from using "yield from"
to instead using "await".

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Add I to the list of ignored flake8 errors. (#42)

I202 warns about newlines between groups of imports in python.
A recent change in flake8
(https://github.com/PyCQA/flake8-import-order/commit/37dafcc35eec9343641d489ac01d316cd10a6c03)
made this start showing up in osrf_pycommon.  Since we use whitespace
between imports, disable this warning in this repository.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: William Woodall
data.message:
process_utils: added execute_process_split() func

This function is identical to execute_process()
except it's output generator yields triplets,
(stdout, stderr, retched), every time with only
one being non-None each time, and stderr is
returned separately from stdout.
